snippet: When the Supreme Court revisits the blurry boundary between church and state it should ensure government neutrality toward all religions.
abstract: Editorial urges Supreme Court to ensure government neutrality toward all religions when it hears oral argument in Town of Greece v Galloway; notes plaintiffs in case sued town of Greece, NY, because local clergy members delivered predominantly Christian prayers before town board meetings; says court is revisiting blurry boundary between church and state for first time in 30 years.
lead_paragraph: When the Supreme Court revisits the blurry boundary between church and state it should ensure government neutrality toward all religions.

headline.main: A Prayer in the Town Hall
headline.print_headline: A Prayer in the Town Hall
